result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Arndt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence credit of 5 days was
granted.  

Consecutive to: Any other sentence
*Transfer allowed to Fond du Lac County

miscConds.notes: Remaining amount of restitution to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before costs or fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Maintain employment and/or school combination - obtain HSED/GED.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the agent.  
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven A Arndt in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Harris makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 5 days)      *Consecutive*

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   -  **Transfer allowed to Fond du Lac County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - obtain HSED/GED

RESTITUTION:  Pay remaining amount owed - $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  20 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
